channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024041604
item.description:
Report X-2024041604

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-03T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/30/2024 at approximately 0845, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 926763 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a paint spill. The shipment is a plastic jerrican that appears to have been damaged by equipment. Approximately 1 liter of liquid spilled from the container. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits and amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report E-2024040650
item.description:
Report E-2024040650

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-02T15:12:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-29
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NMP experienced a UN1760 Clothesline Fresh Bult Laundry Detergent 2 release from (2) 5-gallon poly pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2.5-gallons of product released from two pails due to damage caused by improper loading. The release impacted a 3’ x 12’ area of the trailer floor. The damaged pails were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. Acid gator was then deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted trailer floor. All impacted absorbents and PPE were containerized into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024041562
item.description:
Report X-2024041562

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-02T15:12:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-25
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH facility a steel drum was dropped causing the bottom chime to open spilling all of it's contents. The spill was cleaned up and all materials and the drum were placed into a steel salvage package that will be sent out for disposal as hazardous material. UN spec of packaging was unable to be determined because the contents of the drum covered the exterior of the container.

  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH facility a plastic drum was dropped during the unloading process. The drum suffered a small puncture on the side near the base. It was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024040627
item.description:
Report E-2024040627

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-02T15:12:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-16
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DYNO NOBEL INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 237598
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The CMTV was travelling east on Central Pike. It drove off the right side of the roadway, overcorrected, and then skidded across the center line and overturned onto its side. The CMTV skidded off the roadway through a fence and trees coming to a final rest in the field facing west. During the rollover the force of impact caused the manway failure. Approximately 2,000 lbs. of emulsion spilled from the tank onto the ground. A hazardous materials contractor recovered the spilled emulsion and remediated the soil.

item.title: Report E-2024040571
item.description:
Report E-2024040571

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-24
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NNA experienced a UN3266 Pro-Yellow Plus Super Duty Coil Cleaner release from 2 boxes each containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 6-ounces of product released to the cardboard packaging and pallet only due to a pallet puncture. The impacted cardboard and pallet wood were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. All (8) 1-gallon poly jugs of product were containerized into a separate 55-gallon poly drum along with the spent absorbents. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024040597
item.description:
Report E-2024040597

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-23
  • City: GOODLETTSVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported a spill was found inside of a trailer in Goodlettsville, TN. The spill consists of a combined 1 gallon amount of Sea Foam Motor Treatment (UN1993), which released from 2-1 gallon metal cans due to no dunnage around the contents and they were punctured when loaded against another skid. The liquid impacted the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal, who stated they will clean the spill with Oil Dri and place the contents into a 10 gallon metal drum which was then left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024041352
item.description:
Report X-2024041352

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-20
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was dropped during the unloading process at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained two metal cans with positive closure tabs. One of the can was dented on the side causing the lid to open up and spill the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and anew declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024041245
item.description:
Report X-2024041245

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-19
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It has been brought to our attention that a package was found to be leaking at the unload side. As a precautionary measure, the package was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. Upon examination, it was discovered that the content had a loose cap, leading to a leakage that spread across the other bottles.
